intro: Paronychia echinulata subsp. rouyana, commonly known as the rough-hairy paronychia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons, though it is not closely related to them. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. This subspecies is noted for its resilience and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
